Line 195: Line 195:
=== Ubuntu 8.04 (Hardy Heron) ===
=== Ubuntu 8.04 (Hardy Heron) ===
â
[[Image:Ubuntu 8.04.png|right|thumb|Ubuntu 8.04<br /> (''Hardy Heron'')]]
+
[[Image:Ubuntu.png|right|thumb|Ubuntu 8.04<br /> (''Hardy Heron'')]]
Ubuntu 8.04 (''Hardy Heron''), released on [[2008-04-24]],<ref name="hardy_release">{{cite web |url=http://www.jonobacon.org/?p=1017 | title=Introducing the Hardy Heron |accessdate=2007-08-29}}{{cite web |url=https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+milestone/ubuntu-8.04 | title=Milestone ubuntu-8.04 for Ubuntu due 2008-04-24 |accessdate=2007-10-23}}</ref> is Canonical's eighth and latest release of Ubuntu Linux. It is the second Long Term Support (LTS) release.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuWeeklyNewsletter/Issue36#head-1999d566299f6428162eb2f60acf5d12ad93f5d9|title=Ubuntu Weekly Newsletter: Issue 36|accessdate=2008-06-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.com.com/2100-7344_3-6175365.html?part=rss&tag=2547-1_3-0-5&subj=news|title=Ubuntu's new Linux sports debugging tool|accessdate=2008-06-02}}</ref> Ubuntu 8.04's support will end in April 2011 for desktops and April 2013 for servers. Ubuntu 8.04 included several new features, among them [[Tracker (desktop search software)|Tracker]] desktop search integration<ref>{{web cite|url=http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20071101-ubuntu-developer-summit-lays-out-vision-for-strong-hardy-heron-release.html |title=Ubuntu developer summit Boston|accessdate=2008-06-02}}</ref>, [[Brasero (software)|Brasero]] disk burner<ref name="BrasTransVin" />, [[Transmission (BitTorrent client)|Transmission]] [[BitTorrent client]]<ref name="BrasTransVin" />, [[Vinagre]] [[VNC]] client<ref name="BrasTransVin">{{cite web|url=https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/hardy-changes/2008-January/004677.html|title=Accepted: ubuntu-meta 1.87 (source)|accessdate=2008-01-21}}</ref>, system sound through [[PulseAudio]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/cleanup-audio-jumble|title=Blueprint: "Fix the Linux audio mess once and for all"|publisher=[[Launchpad (website)|Launchpad]]|accessdate=2008-02-01}}</ref>. In addition Ubuntu 8.04 included updates for better [[Tango Desktop Project|Tango]] compliance<ref>{{web cite |url=https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Artwork/Incoming/Hardy |title=Hardy Heron Artwork |accessdate=2007-10-19 |publisher=Ubuntu Wiki}}</ref>, various Compiz usability improvements, automatic grabbing and releasing of the mouse cursor when running on a [[VMware]] virtual machine, and an easier method to remove Ubuntu. Ubuntu 8.04 is the first version of Ubuntu to include the [[Wubi (Ubuntu)|Wubi]] installer on the LiveCD that allows Ubuntu to be installed as a single file on a Windows hard drive without the need to repartition the disk.
Ubuntu 8.04 (''Hardy Heron''), released on [[2008-04-24]],<ref name="hardy_release">{{cite web |url=http://www.jonobacon.org/?p=1017 | title=Introducing the Hardy Heron |accessdate=2007-08-29}}{{cite web |url=https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+milestone/ubuntu-8.04 | title=Milestone ubuntu-8.04 for Ubuntu due 2008-04-24 |accessdate=2007-10-23}}</ref> is Canonical's eighth and latest release of Ubuntu Linux. It is the second Long Term Support (LTS) release.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuWeeklyNewsletter/Issue36#head-1999d566299f6428162eb2f60acf5d12ad93f5d9|title=Ubuntu Weekly Newsletter: Issue 36|accessdate=2008-06-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.com.com/2100-7344_3-6175365.html?part=rss&tag=2547-1_3-0-5&subj=news|title=Ubuntu's new Linux sports debugging tool|accessdate=2008-06-02}}</ref> Ubuntu 8.04's support will end in April 2011 for desktops and April 2013 for servers. Ubuntu 8.04 included several new features, among them [[Tracker (desktop search software)|Tracker]] desktop search integration<ref>{{web cite|url=http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20071101-ubuntu-developer-summit-lays-out-vision-for-strong-hardy-heron-release.html |title=Ubuntu developer summit Boston|accessdate=2008-06-02}}</ref>, [[Brasero (software)|Brasero]] disk burner<ref name="BrasTransVin" />, [[Transmission (BitTorrent client)|Transmission]] [[BitTorrent client]]<ref name="BrasTransVin" />, [[Vinagre]] [[VNC]] client<ref name="BrasTransVin">{{cite web|url=https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/hardy-changes/2008-January/004677.html|title=Accepted: ubuntu-meta 1.87 (source)|accessdate=2008-01-21}}</ref>, system sound through [[PulseAudio]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/cleanup-audio-jumble|title=Blueprint: "Fix the Linux audio mess once and for all"|publisher=[[Launchpad (website)|Launchpad]]|accessdate=2008-02-01}}</ref>. In addition Ubuntu 8.04 included updates for better [[Tango Desktop Project|Tango]] compliance<ref>{{web cite |url=https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Artwork/Incoming/Hardy |title=Hardy Heron Artwork |accessdate=2007-10-19 |publisher=Ubuntu Wiki}}</ref>, various Compiz usability improvements, automatic grabbing and releasing of the mouse cursor when running on a [[VMware]] virtual machine, and an easier method to remove Ubuntu. Ubuntu 8.04 is the first version of Ubuntu to include the [[Wubi (Ubuntu)|Wubi]] installer on the LiveCD that allows Ubuntu to be installed as a single file on a Windows hard drive without the need to repartition the disk.
